title: Granny Flat Arrangement

scenario_info.name: Granny Flat Arrangement
scenario_info.description: Helen transfers her home to her daughter Isabella in exchange for a granny flat right (right to live in the property for life). Since 1 July 2021, CGT does not apply when creating a granny flat arrangement. Helen's main residence exemption covers the transfer, and Isabella has no CGT liability for granting the granny flat right.

expected_result.notes: Both parties exempt - Helen (MRE + granny flat exemption), Isabella (MRE on sale)

applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.80: Granny flat arrangements exempt from CGT (from 1 July 2021)
Helen: MRE applies to transfer + Granny flat CGT exemption
Isabella: No CGT on granting life interest + MRE on eventual sale
Granny flat must be: Written, non-commercial, provide life interest
Transfer for market value = Isabella's cost base for future CGT

property_history.description: Granny flat arrangement created. Helen transfers property to daughter Isabella in exchange for life interest. CGT exempt under s118.80.
Isabella moves in as owner. Helen retains life interest.
Helen passes away. Granny flat arrangement terminates.

properties.notes: Full exemption for all parties. Helen's transfer exempt under MRE + granny flat arrangement (s118.80). Isabella's sale exempt under MRE (lived there as main residence since transfer). Granny flat exemption applies from 1 July 2021.

user_query: My mother transferred her house to me in 2022 in exchange for a granny flat arrangement where she could live there for life. She recently passed away and I'm selling. What are the CGT implications?
